description: From Latin īnsula (“island”) (named for the islets of Langerhans, where insulin is produced)  +‎ -in.

entries.meaning: A polypeptide hormone that regulates carbohydrate metabolism (in various animals including humans).
examples: Ask a dozen persons to tell you what they know about insulin and you will get some surprising and contradictory an- swers. The truth is this: Insulin is not a cure for diabetes, but it is helping to prolong and gladden lives.

entries.meaning: Any exogenous preparation of this hormone for use as a medication.
(broadly) Any exogenous preparation of this hormone or its analogues for use as a medication.
